meanings.definition: To allot or distribute in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will preallot the tasks for the group project.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to preallot seats for important guests at events.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to preallot the food among themselves, causing chaos in the picnic area.
meanings.sent4: The captain preallotted the roles to the crew, turning the ship into a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: She preallotted her time wisely, ensuring she could complete all her tasks efficiently.

meanings.sent1: The manager will preallot the work schedule for next week.
meanings.sent2: Please preallot the meeting rooms for the upcoming conference.
meanings.sent3: The robots were programmed to preallot the tasks, but they ended up causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller seemed to preallot destinies to her clients with uncanny accuracy.
meanings.sent5: He preallotted the responsibilities among his team members, ensuring a smooth workflow.
